body: Hi everyone, this should be ready for review now.
Running checks, merging on monday!
@gerlowskija I believe I have addressed all your comments above. Please feel free to review again if you think any other changes are necessary.
@risdenk Could you please have a look at it any time soon, thanks

### ⚠ Artifact update problem

So, just to confirm my understanding on this patch, we would apply it ONLY to `main`, and apply it to `branch_9x` because it changes the default pattern...

@risdenk I see this was reverted from main, but I still see it in branch_9x. I'm getting conflicts when trying to backport https://github.com/apache/solr/pull/1610. Do you want to revert this before I backport the other one?
O shoot if that is the case I made a mistake. I'll take care of branch_9x shortly. Sorry
@HoustonPutman yup you were right I didn't revert from branch_9x. Its been fixed now. Sorry about that.
No worries, thanks for taking care of that!

> I will go through your comments and then work on the changes you have suggested.

Awesome, glad to hear it.  Let me know if you run into any problems along the way!
Hi @sayandigital - thanks again for your work on this.  Let me know if I can help out with any questions or issues that crop up when you get a chance to circle back to this!
My concerns have been addressed!

@janhoy what do you think of calling this "IndexTool" instead of "PostTool"....   And `bin/solr index` versus `bin/solr post`....    I worry that post overlaps with api...?    Though then I worry folks will think it's a full on indexing solution.....   but...

> @janhoy what do you think of calling this "IndexTool" instead of "PostTool".... And `bin/solr index` versus `bin/solr post`.... I worry that post overlaps with api...? Though then I worry folks will think it's a full on indexing solution..... but...

Until now we have pitched the SimplePostTool as a dev tool, and discouraged from relying on it in production use. Do you think that will change now that it becomes an official tool in bin/solr? I'm ok with people using it to script a small environment, but I'm not prepared to handle bug reports for the file traversal, web crawling or error handling parts of the tool.

What about refering to it as `PostToy` to highlight that it is more a toy than a tool 😄
@HoustonPutman plz review
Still working on unit test and backward compatibility.
Awesome, thanks for the quick turnaround @mlbiscoc !  Will review shortly

> So there might be plugins that aren't authentication that might need the Solr classloader on initialization. Is there are issue doing this `try {} finally {}` in `load()` instead of in `initializeAuthentication()`?
> 

No issue, it simply has to be decided if the usage of a custom context class loader should be as isolated as possible or not.
Both ways will work.

> We could also just do this `try {} finally {}` logic in `EmbeddedSolrServer. load(CoreContainer cc)`. That way it works for embedded use cases. I'm not sure if theres any gain to solving this outside of the embedded use case.

Sure, but i think it would be better to have a defined scope where this context class loader should/must be active.

At the end someone has to decide it, personally i would only use a different context class loader for the parts where it is required.

Ok I moved the logic to surround the entire load method.

For future PRs, please make them against `main`, not any other branch. I'm going to edit this PR to make it work though.

Do you mind if I force push to your `branch_9x`, I'm going to push the current `main` with these two commits cherry-picked on top? You will need to reset (delete and recreate) the branch after this PR gets merged, but at least we get to keep the PR history...
Alright, tests and 'check' look good.  Merging this now to main, will backport in a few days if fucit doesn't show any spikes in the backup-related tests.

> Do you mind if I force push to your `branch_9x`, I'm going to push the current `main` with these two commits cherry-picked on top? You will need to reset (delete and recreate) the branch after this PR gets merged, but at least we get to keep the PR history...

No problem, just force push

> Ok I moved the logic to surround the entire load method.
> 
> For future PRs, please make them against `main`, not any other branch. I'm going to edit this PR to make it work though.

👌
Should be handled in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SOLR-16799

### Renovate Ignore Notification

Because you closed this PR without merging, Renovate will ignore this update (9.6.0). You will get a PR once a newer version is released. To ignore this dependency forever, add it to the `ignoreDeps` array of your Renovate config.

If you accidentally closed this PR, or if you changed your mind: rename this PR to get a fresh replacement PR.
My 11 year old is reviewing this PR ;-)

I think the extract function may be out of scope since I can't get the `/update/extract/` end  point to work on Main..  Something is up with that....    The code in `bin/solr post` is properly posting ;-)
@epugh are we able to merge that now? not sure if @risdenk will review it anytime soon

Alright, changes look great!  I'm going to make a few tweaks, mostly to method names and Javadoc and then aim to merge later today after I get a clean test run.

Thanks @mlbiscoc !
Ok, it looks like I can't force push to your repo. Could you force push main:branch_9x? I think I can cherry pick the commits after that.
Thanks again @mlbiscoc - let me know if you decide to pick up any other v2 API tickets that need review!

So is this change actually necessary? @clayburn at least from Apache Jenkins jobs it looks like build scans are automagically being published?

https://ci-builds.apache.org/job/Solr/job/Solr-Check-main/ -> https://ci-builds.apache.org/job/Solr/job/Solr-Check-main/6911/ -> https://ci-builds.apache.org/job/Solr/job/Solr-Check-main/6911/buildScans/ -> https://ge.apache.org/s/446qtyw65lwgw

this applies it looks like to all Apache Solr jobs at least without this change. Same goes for Lucene.

> Ok, it looks like I can't force push to your repo. Could you force push main:branch_9x? I think I can cherry pick the commits after that.

Done, i pushed branch_9x over main, they are equal now
Sorry, its the other way around, you need to push main on top of your branch_9x.

> Sorry, its the other way around, you need to push main on top of your branch_9x.

Ok, should i cherry pick the changes already, from the local branch_9x?
Cherry pick is already done

Tada! Thanks for the help there.

I think this is good to go. Will ask for another review and add a changelog entry.

> Tada! Thanks for the help there.
> 
> I think this is good to go. Will ask for another review and add a changelog entry.

Okay, thx for your fast response, if any further actions are required just let me know.

@risdenk Good question. This adds the Gradle Enterprise for all builds, not just those executed via Jenkins. This means that local development builds will also produce build scans when an access key is present.
Hello, is there any other additional comments or suggestions to review for improving this PR?
Going to merge today once checks run!
@mkhludnev  I assume you saw the precommit errors!

> @mkhludnev I assume you saw the precommit errors!

Absolutely, @epugh

The logic for moving replicas is now shared between ReplaceNodeCmd and BalanceReplicasCmd.

This introduced more stuff to review, but the logic is the exact same, so the best path forward is to have both classes share it.
@HoustonPutman Created https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SOLR-16815 for the `licenses/` folder followup.
Just pushed a positive case as a separate DocumentBuilder test. Adding a catchAll to the main DocumentBuilder test caused a failure in a non-vector test method so I split it out to its own test.
With one +1 via review and no other feedback after a few days, merging
I rebased on latest main branch and re-built the convenience distribution tar, available at http://www.cominvent.com/pub/solr-10.0.0-SNAPSHOT-slim.tgz (small download).

### Renovate Ignore Notification

Because you closed this PR without merging, Renovate will ignore this update. You will not get PRs for *any* future 3.x releases. But if you manually upgrade to 3.x then Renovate will re-enable `minor` and `patch` updates automatically.

If you accidentally closed this PR, or if you changed your mind: rename this PR to get a fresh replacement PR.

Okay, I think I am down to 1) Testing Solr Basic Auth handling, which I may treat seperately, and 2) Test my change to solr.cmd...   Would love someone to confirm on windows that `bin/solr.cmd post -url http://localhost:8983/gettingstarted/update c:\mysolr\example\films\films.json` works.     My attemtps to run virtualbox and windows 10 have been dismal failures.
@gerlowskija just checking / reminding myself -- these big changes in V2 API are not expected to be backwards-compatible; right?

Yep, @dsmiley !  The v2 API is "experimental" so that we can change it without deference to backcompat.  Of course, if a PR meant to update a v2 API breaks the corresponding v1, that'd still be an issue/violation.  But breaking changes to v2 are "expected".
Thank you @stillalex for this!
@gerlowskija please take a look and let me know what you think!
mentioning PR https://github.com/apache/solr/pull/1495 again, GH did not seem to link it to the other one correctly just by the description only.
thanks @epugh for merging!
I don't see how the failures are related to this PR. I only introduced an extra test
Tests added!
They are likely unrelated. You can look here for tests that fail "often": http://fucit.org/solr-jenkins-reports/failure-report.html
(Tests pass for me locally - the Crave failures appear to be known flaky tests, so I'm going to proceed with merging.)
I'm going to temporarily close this one as the [lucene PR](https://github.com/apache/lucene/pull/12293) undergoes review. I'll reopen once that is done with changes matching those changes.

Good catch on the test failure.  Tests/check pass for me locally, will merge shortly and let Jenkins chew on it through the weekend before backporting.

Thanks Alex!

Awesome @bszabo97 , thanks for taking these on.  Everything looks great as-is!  I'm gonna spike out a few unit tests for these APIs (maybe using a `JerseyTest` base, or maybe using mocks), but then I'll add a CHANGES.txt entry and merge!
This is ready for review and comments!  I'd like to merge it next week.
@epugh Eric Pugh, could you please review this PR

Morning @HoustonPutman - is this mature enough to review at this point, or still very much undergoing heavy change?

Just figured I'd check before diving in.  Exciting PR!
Thank you for fixing the issues and describing the solution. I am still working on some other endpoints that are part of this ticket and these remarks are very useful there as well.
Yeah not ready for a review yet, still deciding on whether this is the right way to go or not. Thanks for checking though!

I'm not a  fan of this solution. Yet a place of strings to maintain. 

What is wrong with the ClassNotFound exception you (probably) already get? Does it not tell you clearly the problem? Then you fix your class name and it works. If we should start adding such lists to all kind of plugins it would be a maintenance nightmare.

> I'm not a fan of this solution. Yet a place of strings to maintain.
> 
> What is wrong with the ClassNotFound exception you (probably) already get? Does it not tell you clearly the problem? Then you fix your class name and it works. If we should start adding such lists to all kind of plugins it would be a maintenance nightmare.

I accept "ClassNotFound exception" is sufficient to find the issue. But problem arises when we upgrade from Solr 8(or lower) versions to Solr 9. In Solr 8 we have "org.apache.solr.security.*Plugin" as per doc, but in Solr 9 it got modified to use 'solr.*Plugin'.

So we assume that what we configured is correct ,as per old document, if we miss this change, and continue with "org.apache.solr.security.*Plugin" security.json file. But I accept one has to go thro' the new documentation before upgradation.
Merged, thanks again @bszabo97 !  Will backport as long as the tests look OK in a few days or so

The `org.apache.solr.security.*Plugin` still works, but the issue is that the package name changed for the KerberosPlugin from `org.apache.solr.security` (8.x) to `org.apache.solr.security.hadoop` (9.x). This should be included in the upgrade notes, I don't know why it wasn't.

I think that's the path forward, just document the change (and we can backport the upgrade notes change, so that it's included in 9.0, 9.1 and 9.2).

> The `org.apache.solr.security.*Plugin` still works, but the issue is that the package name changed for the KerberosPlugin from `org.apache.solr.security` (8.x) to `org.apache.solr.security.hadoop` (9.x). This should be included in the upgrade notes, I don't know why it wasn't.
> 
> I think that's the path forward, just document the change (and we can backport the upgrade notes change, so that it's included in 9.0, 9.1 and 9.2).

Oh okay, then both org.apache.solr.security.hadoop.*Plugin and solr.*Plugin works? If it is so I can change in doc

Oh okay, then both org.apache.solr.security.hadoop.*Plugin and solr.*Plugin works? If it is so I can change in doc

> Oh okay, then both org.apache.solr.security.hadoop.*Plugin and solr.*Plugin works? If it is so I can change in doc

It should work yes. We should just add a line in `solr/solr-ref-guide/modules/upgrade-notes/pages/major-changes-in-solr-9.adoc` for 9.0, that the hdfs file locations have changed. There's a line about the code moving to a module, but it doesn't mention the classpaths.
@dsmiley I noticed you've done some work with the prometheus exporter. Would you have any input for these changes?
@HoustonPutman may I ask you to have a look at AffinityPlacementFactory changes?
I didn't add a changelog entry thinking this was too minor..

> Oh okay, then both org.apache.solr.security.hadoop.*Plugin and solr.*Plugin works? If it is so I can change in doc
> 
> > Oh okay, then both org.apache.solr.security.hadoop.*Plugin and solr.*Plugin works? If it is so I can change in doc
> 
> It should work yes. We should just add a line in `solr/solr-ref-guide/modules/upgrade-notes/pages/major-changes-in-solr-9.adoc` for 9.0, that the hdfs file locations have changed. There's a line about the code moving to a module, but it doesn't mention the classpaths.

This is better way to proceed
Closing this, please open a new PR with Upgrade Notes doc changes...
This looks great to me. I can take care of backporting to all of the branches @janhoy , so that all versions of the ref guide get this fix.
Thanks @janhoy !
I merged to main, `9x`, `9_2`, `9_1` and `9_0`, think that are all the guide versions?

Thanks @janhoy and @senthh - SOLR-13989 is what introduced this. When I looked through our docs nothing specifically had the full class always `solr.ABC` so it didn't occur to me to put this in the upgrade notes. Sorry.

Spring is a transitive test-dependency for s3-repository and jwt-auth.
I tried removing the two lines from `versions.props` and ended up with this

```
org.springframework.*  5.3.23 -> 5.2.15.RELEASE
org.springframework.boot.*  2.5.14 -> 2.3.12.RELEASE
```

Seems like the lines were added during upgrade to Jetty 10 in SOLR-15955 with the comment `* For s3mock specifically, upgrade spring-boot 2.5.14 and spring 5.3.23 to handle Jetty 10`. 

I'd like to get us back to having these as transitive dependencies, and add a comment-line to `versions.props` on why these are overridden. 

Upgrading s3mock to `2.11.0` would solve the problem, but I see you tried this in April but rolled back @risdenk , @gerlowskija  - remember why we had to roll back?
@janhoy  - https://github.com/apache/solr/pull/1545
Thanks, made a comment. Closing this.

@wrunderwood , @atris , it's a shame that this fine PR was abandoned due to bike shedding. Perhaps 24 months distance can help put it in a new light and get this ball rolling again? I'm also keen on CB on the update side of Solr.
@atris It is unclear to me what remains to land this fine PR. Where is review still needed? Where is help still needed?

I've left this as a "draft" to signal that I don't intend to merge it imminently, but this is largely ready to go if anyone wants to review or pull it down to try out.  I'd really love some feedback if anyone has a chance to "kick the tires" on their own.

In terms of "timeline" for merging: there's another ticket similar to this one that's targeting Java code generation, and I'd like to make a little progress there before I merge here.  (I don't want to do anything in this PR that makes Java-generation harder, or vice versa.)
(Note to self that this still needs a CHANGES.txt entry)

Do you have any suggestions how I could test the `ManagedIndexSchema` branch in the code?
